title: MINISTRY OF FINANCE
author: ''
date: '2022-08-29'
slug: ministry_of_finance
categories: []
tags: []
r_init: |-
  
description: The Government of Canada spent an estimated $2.3M
  in 2021-2022 on contracts with MINISTRY OF FINANCE. The average
  contract duration was 2.63 year, and the average contract
  value (not including contracts under $10k) was $597.4K.
  The longest contract was 29.02 year. The largest contract
  by value (including amendments) was $4.3M.
most_recent_fiscal_year_total: '2.3M'
most_recent_fiscal_year_year: '2021-2022'
s431_number_of_contracts_by_vendor: '36'
s431_number_of_contracts_by_vendor_with_amendments: '2'
s431_number_of_contracts_amendments_percentage: '6%'
s432_mean_amendment_increase_percentage_by_vendor: '16%'
s434_mean_number_of_amendments_by_vendor: '1'
s433_total_amendment_increase_value_by_vendor: '256.5K'
s424_mean_duration_by_vendor: '2.63'
s421_mean_contract_value_by_vendor: '597.4K'
s425_max_duration_by_vendor: '29.02'
s422_max_contract_value_by_vendor: '4.3M'
